TopicTitle: What is this Part Upgrades option?

Articles.Content:
The advanced settings tab has an option for Part Upgrades.

The mouse hover info does not reveal too much.  It suggest to me that parts can be upgraded.  I do not remember reading anything like this in the change log.

What is the function of this option?

Edited October 23, 2016 by MoeslyArmlis

If I recall correctly, this does nothing in a stock game. It is supposed to allow modders to implement upgrading of parts (for example improvement of ISP/thrust for higher "versions") into their mods. I don't know whether stock part upgrades are planned in future versions.

Michal.don

Experimental feature that was added in 1.2, but stock doesn't take advantage of it yet. Well, not unless you download Porkjet's rocket revamp preview parts that were released along with 1.2 prerelease in order to demo this feature to modders who might want to make use of it.

PartUpgrades are things you can put in the tech tree which, upon unlocking them, modify existing parts. For example, remember how the LV-T engine series is always worse stats-wise than later Rockomax and Kerbodyne series, even taking size into account, just because they come so early in the progression? Now you could put a PartUpgrade into a later node that buffs the LV-T's to the same standard as the later engines. One PartUpgrade can affect one or multiple parts, and a part can have one or multiple PartUpgrades (or none, of course). They can even change the role of a part completely. For example, I have played with the thought of writing my own PartUpgrade that turns the Flea SRB into a solid upper stage motor with less thrust and better vacuum Isp, but worse sea level Isp. So halfway through the tech tree (depending on where I put it), the thing suddenly becomes useful for a completely new use.

The system doesn't seem fully finished yet - for example, the VAB/SPH part info cannot display updated stats, you can only see them by adding the part to a spacecraft and then using the rightclick menu on that part. But it's technically functional, and it works off of the same ConfigNode syntax as all other part configs.
